content.description: short crack climb on the wall right of steel miner. climb steel miner to its first bolt, then move up to the right under an overhang. climb up and slightly right passing 2 bolts to an overhang. From here follow a crack to the top. Variation: Pine Sap Overhang 5.10a - Instead of traversing left to gain the crack, climb directly out over the overhang passing a bolt, then linking back up to the crack.
content.protection: a few bolts, a standard rack / no bolted anchor

content.description: There is currently another listing for steel miner at the left end location, however steel miner is actually located in the middle of the cliff. From the alcove/perched dirt ledge, begin climbing up a long ramp that is joined by a wall to its right side. Follow the bolts and put in gear when necessary.
content.protection: 4-5 bolts, some small to medium sized gear / 2 bolt anchor
content.location: From the base of R U Urban and the other 3 long sport routes, find the path of least resistance further right and up to a dirty ledge/perch. It's kind of a small amphitheater with a very obvious crack system going straight up the top. Steel Miner is the route that follows bolts up a long ramp.

content.description: climb up the face right of the major crack system under an arching overhang. climb past bolts following a shallow crack, climb through an overhang (crux) then another 30 feet to an anchor.
content.location: 25 feet to the right of prospector

content.description: follow the 50 foot long slab with bolts up to the big tree and then up the headwall. Continue up through a few steep sections and arrive at the anchor. cannot toprope this route even with a 70M
content.location: walk past the fixed rope for Deception and the first slab you see to your left with a really low overhang at the start. Look up the slab and you wll see expansion bolts

content.description: Begin on the right side of the ledge under the large tree, climb the central crack system passing a large tree at the lower part of the route. finish at a 2 bolt anchor
content.location: central crack system to the right of the steel miner ramp

content.description: Climb up a 40' slab with bolts to a section of orange-ish rock, take the right line of bolts heading out right around the arete onto a low angled face. Continue up the face and a few coner systems to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Slab of bolts to the right of "R U Urban?"

climbs.name: Piece Out
climbs.fa: Nick Ruschmeyer, Bill Mitchell, Matt Farney 2016

content.description: Climb the 40' slab of bolts, climbing to a section of orange-ish rock, take the line of bolts going left around the overhang, climbing back right to finish at a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Slab of bolts to the right of "R U Urban?"

content.description: Climb the 40' slab of bolts to a section of orange-ish rock. climb the line of bolts going up into the orange rock, bust out right over the arete and finish up the face to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Slab of bolts right of "R U Urban?"

content.description: work up the face on good holds trending left following a line of bolts. Quite fun and some thoughtful movement, potentially a good lead for someone looking to graduate from the no eyed deer sport routes.
content.protection: bolts to a 2 bolt ring anchor
content.location: from the no eyed deer corner, walk downhill a few yards and look up left, you will see a black fixed line attached to a tree. Use this to perch yourself under the route. You will see the line of bolts out to your left. It is recommended to bring a cordelette, sling and/or some trad gear to make an anchor for the belayer, as the stance is a little exposed.

content.description: The middle part of the cliff of prospect rock is home to a few longer routes including Steel Miner, Prospector, Right Wing Reach and a few others. Can be quite sunny and warm.
